channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: Hyperbitcoinization is underway, RFK seeks Bitcoin donations and other news: Hodler’s Digest, May 14-20
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Editorial Staff
item.description: Hyperbitcoinization is on the horizon, Bitcoin gets a seat on U.S. presidential candidates agendas and Voyager’s fund recovery plan approved.

item.title: Crypto Biz: Tether flees from banks, Ledger’s backdoor for seed phrases and more
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: This week’s Crypto Biz explores Tether’s first quarter audit, Ripple’s partial victory against the SEC, Worldcoin fundraising and Ledger’s controversial recovery service.

item.title: Bitcoin FOMO is gone, portfolio managers are taking BTC seriously — 3iQ CEO
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: In an interview with Cointelegraph during the Bitcoin 2023, Fred Pye spoke about how Canada's advanced regulation for crypto trading is drawing investors to the digital assets market.

item.title: Binance provider in Brazil gets payment institution approval
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Binance's partner Latam Gateway has been granted a license to operate as a payment institution and electronic money issuer in Brazil.

item.title: Bitcoin forgets Fed as trader eyes classic BTC price 'liquidity hunt'
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Conditions are ripe for a Bitcoin range breakout, but fears among traders are that a deep correction is due.

item.title: Bitcoin Ordinals' total mintage fees increase 700% from April: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: The total number of Bitcoin Ordinals has surpassed 8 million since its inception in January.

item.title: Who invented NFTs?: A brief history of nonfungible tokens
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Dilip Kumar Patairya
item.description: Ever wondered who invented nonfungible tokens — aka NFTs? The timeline includes colored coins, quantum, CryptoPunks and a lot more.

item.title: Monero community lashes out against ‘Mordinals’ amid privacy concerns
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Anupam Varshney
item.description: It’s always been possible to store arbitrary data alongside blockchain transactions, but NFTs on Monero introduce a slew of new concerns.

item.title: How crypto funds shape the development of the digital asset market
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Anthony Clarke
item.description: A look at the role played by crypto funds in providing essential capital and liquidity, propelling the growth and expansion of the crypto market.

item.title: How to use cloud storage effectively
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Alice Ivey
item.description: Learn how to maximize the benefits of cloud storage by organizing files, securing data and syncing across devices effectively.

item.title: Ripple vs. SEC: Could newly released documents tip the balance?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Luke Huigsloot
item.description: The court case between SEC and Ripple Labs has been ongoing for nearly two and a half years, but a summary judgment ruling could be made any day.

item.title: Bankrupt crypto hedge fund 3AC’s NFT auction fetches $2.5M
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: Three Arrows Capital is currently undergoing bankruptcy proceedings and owes an estimated $3.5 billion to creditors.

item.title: Instagram to reportedly launch text-based app to rival Twitter
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
item.description: The upcoming app will maintain a Twitter-like centralized feed, allowing users to view content such as text, images and videos shared by followers and recommended accounts.

item.title: ‘Big Short’ author Michael Lewis almost ready to publish book on SBF
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.category: Going Infinite: The Rise and Fall of a New Tycoon
item.description: The author didn’t want to give away too many details on the book, but did note that his recounting of the FTX collapse “aims to read like a piece of fiction.“

item.title: Ledger co-founder clarifies ‘there is no backdoor’ in ‘Recover’ firmware update
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
item.description: Ledger Recover is an over-the-air firmware update allowing users to back up their seed phrases by third-party entities if they opt-in to the new service.

item.title: Strike moves global headquarters to El Salvador, expands to 65 countries
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
item.description: According to Strike CEO Jack Mallers, the expansion drive aims to counter the “clouded world of crypto exchanges and hidden unregistered licensing regimes, and 1,000 different coins.”

item.title: $3M worth of customer funds swiped via alleged Swaprum DEX rug pull
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: Promptly after the funds went missing, Swaprum’s Twitter, Telegram and GitHub accounts were all deleted; however, its website is still up.

item.title: Users will decide if they can still trust Ledger with their seed phrases
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By J.W. Verret
item.description: Ledger’s decision to introduce a third party to your wallet seed phrase created an exploit that could appeal to both governments and hackers.

item.title: Bug in Aave v2 Polygon causes some assets to become stuck in contracts
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: The bug only affects the Polygon implementation; v3 is unaffected.

item.title: Blockchain technology platform Bakkt looks toward Europe after MiCA
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: Bakkt’s chief product officer, Dan O’Prey, expressed his optimism about the future of Bitcoin and the company’s outlook on regulated markets when he chatted with Cointelegraph at Bitcoin 2023.

item.title: Tether, KriptonMarket to support USDT transactions at Argentina’s Central Market
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: The Central Market supplies over 12 million people per month in Argentina. The move will allow companies to accept and pay bills with USDT.

item.title: Ethereum users are increasingly demanding self-custody: Casa CTO
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: Security expert Jameson Lopp said some users lost Ethereum tokens because of the lack of a secure storage method.

item.title: Bitcoin production growth and capital strategy guiding Marathon Digital: CEO
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: In an exclusive interview with Cointelegraph at the Bitcoin Conference, Marathon Digital CEO Fred Thiel spoke about the mining company’s response to the bear market.

item.title: BitDAO passes BIP-21 token optimization and branding proposal
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tristan Greene
item.category: a proposal seeking to rebrand the BitDAO governance structure and Mantle network under the Mantle name passed with a large majority on May 19.
item.description: A proposal to unify branding between the Mantle network and BitDAO passed with overwhelming support.

item.title: US Justice Department on the hunt for DeFi hackers and thieves: Finance Redefined
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: The total value locked in DeFi protocols fell below $50 billion after nearly a month of bullish price action.

item.title: Price analysis 5/19: BTC, ETH, BNB, XRP, ADA, DOGE, MATIC, SOL, DOT, LTC
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Rakesh Upadhyay
item.description: The recovery in Bitcoin and most major altcoins halted near respective overhead resistance levels, indicating that the bears are active at higher levels.

item.title: Ripple and SEC seek extension for unsealing Hinman documents
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Judith BannermanQuist
item.description: According to court documents shared by James Filan, the Hinman materials will likely be unsealed by June 13.

item.title: NY Fed and MAS publish joint CBDC cross-border payment project results
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: The researchers built on their separate projects to demonstrate cross-border payments using illiquid currencies with an intermediate “vehicle” currency.

item.title: Bitcoin cleans up the environment and helps catch criminals: US Senator Cynthia Lummis
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tristan Greene
item.description: U.S. Senator Cynthia Lummis joined Chamber of Digital Commerce CEO Perianne Boring on stage at Bitcoin 2023 in Miami for a lengthy discussion on regulation.

item.title: Breaking: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. to accept campaign donations in Bitcoin
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: It is the first political campaign in U.S. history to accept Bitcoin donations.
